<Summary source="https://www.macrotrends.net/global-metrics/countries/nam/namibia/inflation-rate-cpi">
# Summary of Article: Namibia Inflation Rate | Historical Chart & Data (Macrotrends)

## Key Facts and Statistics:

**Historical Annual Inflation Rates:**
- **2024:** 4.24% (a decline of 1.64% from 2023)
- **2023:** 5.88% (a decline of 0.20% from 2022)
- **2022:** 6.08% (an increase of 2.46% from 2021)
- **2021:** 3.62% (an increase of 1.41% from 2020)

## Methodology Note:
The article notes that inflation is measured by the consumer price index, reflecting the annual percentage change in the cost to the average consumer of acquiring a basket of goods and services. The Laspeyres formula is generally used for this calculation.

## Data Availability:
The source indicates that a full historical dataset covering 2003-2024 is available for download.

---

**Note:** This article provides only historical annual inflation data through 2024 and does not contain forward-looking projections, expert opinions, or monthly breakdowns that would directly inform the March 2026 inflation forecast.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://nsa.org.na/document/national-core-inflation-rates-for-september-2025/">
## Summary of Article

**Disclaimer**: The extracted content appears to be primarily the website header/navigation structure of the Namibia Statistics Agency website rather than the full article content about National Core Inflation rates for September 2025. The substantive inflation data that would typically be in such a report is not visible in the extracted text.

### Key Information Retrieved:

**Demographic Statistics (appears to be general background data, not specific to the inflation article):**
- Total Population: 3,022,401
- Male Population: 1,474,224 (48.77%)
- Female Population: 1,548,177 (51.27%)
- Young Children (0-14 Years): 37%
- Working age Population (15-59 years): 56.1%
- Urban Population: 49.5%
- Rural Population: 50.5%
- Number of Households: 756,339
- Average Household size: 3.8

**Document Details:**
- Title references "National Core Inflation rates for September 2025"
- Content source: Namibia Statistics Agency
- File Type: xls (Excel spreadsheet)
- Category: Namibia Consumer Price Index Bulletin (NCPI)

**Note**: The actual inflation rate figures, analysis, and detailed statistics for September 2025 that would be expected in this bulletin are not present in the extracted content. To properly assess this source for forecasting purposes, access to the full document content would be necessary.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/FP.CPI.TOTL.ZG?locations=NA">
## Summary of World Bank Open Data Article

**Disclaimer:** The extracted web content appears to be from a World Bank Open Data interface page rather than a traditional article. The content is fragmentary and consists primarily of navigation elements and metadata rather than substantive analytical content.

### Key Information Extracted:

**Data Source:**
- The page references inflation data for Namibia from the International Financial Statistics database, International Monetary Fund (IMF)
- License: CC BY-4.0

**Data Coverage:**
- The page indicates data availability from 2003-2024
- The metric tracked is "Inflation, consumer prices (annual %)" for Namibia

**Related Indicators Mentioned:**
- Consumer price index (2010 = 100)
- Wholesale price index (2010 = 100)
- Various banking and financial sector indicators

**Limitations:**
The extracted content does not contain:
- Actual inflation values or statistics for any specific time periods
- Analysis or commentary on Namibian inflation trends
- Forward-looking projections or forecasts
- Expert opinions or assessments

This appears to be a data portal landing page that would require interactive navigation to access the actual historical inflation figures for Namibia. No substantive facts, statistics, or analysis relevant to forecasting March 2026 inflation rates are present in the extracted content.
</Summary>
<Summary query="Namibia CPI December 2025 NSA bulletin">No usable content extracted from any URL.</Summary>

<Agent_report>
Query: Provide Namibia monthly headline inflation rates 2019-2025 and any published forecasts for 2026; include Bank of Namibia and IMF projections
The material retrieved in the most-recent crawl still falls well short of what is required to answer the user’s request, which calls for a strictly numerical deliverable covering three components:

A.  The full Namibia headline-CPI (year-on-year) series for every month from January-2019 through December-2025 (84 observations).  
B.  A Bank of Namibia (BoN) forecast—point or range—for calendar-year-2026 average inflation.  
C.  An IMF forecast for Namibia’s 2026 average consumer-price inflation.

What the new search results contribute

1.  Monthly history (Component A) – still missing
    •  The Namibia Statistics Agency (NSA) “Inflation” landing page is reachable (nsa.org.na/inflation) but only displays narrative snippets; no embedded tables are present and no bulk CSV/Excel file is exposed in the HTML (source 1.2).  
    •  Past experience shows that the NSA posts a separate Excel workbook for each monthly CPI release, and the worksheet “NCPI_Main_Index_Headline_YoY” contains the required headline rate in a fixed cell. None of the current search results exposes these files, so the 84 monthly values remain unavailable.

2.  BoN 2026 forecast (Component B) – only secondary references
    •  A Reuters/ CNBC-Africa article (previous crawl) quoted the BoN as having “revised up its … forecast … for 2026 to 4.5 %” on 16-Apr-2025.  
    •  Finance-in-Africa (16-Oct-2025) cites a downward revision by the BoN MPC to “4 %” for 2026 (Finance in Africa, Oct 2025).  
    •  Two PDFs served from bon.com.na were fetched in binary form but rendered unreadable in the crawler (sources with GUIDs cbe629ce-… and 6a7078db-…). These are very likely the “Economic Outlook” or “Inflation Outlook” reports that carry the official forecast table, but without the ability to open them the exact figure (and its vintage) cannot be confirmed.  
    ⇒ We have two competing secondary-source numbers (4.5 % and 4.0 %) and no primary BoN document.

3.  IMF 2026 forecast (Component C) – still not numeric
    •  Ecofin Agency (17-Jun-2025) paraphrases the IMF Article IV staff report: “inflation is expected to average 4.1 % in 2025 and around 4.5 % over the medium term.” “Around 4.5 %” is not an acceptable point estimate.  
    •  No result exposes the 2026 entry of IMF WEO series “PCPIPCH” (Inflation, average consumer prices, percent change) in table form.

Gap assessment versus user specification

• Component A: 0 % filled – all 84 monthly rates still missing.  
• Component B: partially filled – only secondary evidence; conflicting figures (4 % vs 4.5 %); no primary BoN PDF opened.  
• Component C: 0 % filled – no discrete 2026 IMF value.

Therefore additional information IS required before a defensible answer can be produced.

Recommended retrieval steps

1.  Harvest the NSA Excel workbooks from January-2019 through December-2025 (the files follow a predictable URL pattern under https://nsa.org.na/wp-content/uploads/…) and extract the headline YoY rate from the worksheet “NCPI_Main_Index_Headline_YoY”. This will populate the required 84-row monthly series.

2.  Re-download the latest BoN “Inflation Outlook”, “Economic Outlook”, or Monetary Policy Committee statement dated Q4-2025 or later, open the PDF locally, and read the table usually headed “Inflation Forecast (annual average, %)” or similar to obtain the official 2026 figure and its publication date.

3.  Pull Namibia’s 2026 “PCPIPCH” value either via the IMF WEO online interface (Download CSV) or the public JSON API:
   https://www.imf.org/external/datamapper/PCPIPCH@WEO/NA  
   This single call will return the 2026 forecast in machine-readable form.

Until those three retrieval operations succeed, the numerical table requested by the user cannot be delivered with the required accuracy and primary-source citations.</Agent_report>
